rev.comment: i think quote template is more appropriate
rev.diff:
Line 54: Line 54:
Individuals associated with CEI have also been criticised. [[Steven Milloy]] has written extensively on global warming and other topics while receiving undisclosed funding from [[ExxonMobil]].<ref name="tnr">[http://www.tnr.com/doc.mhtml?i=20060206&s=thacker020606 "Smoked Out: Pundit For Hire"], published in ''The New Republic'', accessed 20 Sept 2006. Also [http://www.freepress.net/news/print.php?id=13581 available without subscription] at FreePress.net.</ref><ref name="PRWatch1">[http://www.prwatch.org/prwissues/2000Q3/junkman.html PRWatch.org article detailing Milloy's ties to the tobacco industry], accessed 23 Sept 2006.</ref><ref name="ucs">{{cite web|url=http://www.ucsusa.org/news/press_release/ExxonMobil-GlobalWarming-tobacco.html|title=Scientists' Report Documents ExxonMobilâs Tobacco-like Disinformation Campaign on Global Warming Science|date=[[3 January]] [[2007]]|publisher=[[Union of Concerned Scientists]]|accessdate=2007-01-11}}</ref><ref name="mojo">[http://www.motherjones.com/news/feature/2005/05/some_like_it_hot.html Some Like It Hot, ''Mother Jones'' article on Milloy]</ref> Milloy is now an adjunct analyst at CEI.<ref name="titleCEI Experts">{{cite web |url=http://www.cei.org/dyn/experts.cfm |title=CEI Experts |accessdate=2008-03-07 |format= |work=}}</ref>
Individuals associated with CEI have also been criticised. [[Steven Milloy]] has written extensively on global warming and other topics while receiving undisclosed funding from [[ExxonMobil]].<ref name="tnr">[http://www.tnr.com/doc.mhtml?i=20060206&s=thacker020606 "Smoked Out: Pundit For Hire"], published in ''The New Republic'', accessed 20 Sept 2006. Also [http://www.freepress.net/news/print.php?id=13581 available without subscription] at FreePress.net.</ref><ref name="PRWatch1">[http://www.prwatch.org/prwissues/2000Q3/junkman.html PRWatch.org article detailing Milloy's ties to the tobacco industry], accessed 23 Sept 2006.</ref><ref name="ucs">{{cite web|url=http://www.ucsusa.org/news/press_release/ExxonMobil-GlobalWarming-tobacco.html|title=Scientists' Report Documents ExxonMobilâs Tobacco-like Disinformation Campaign on Global Warming Science|date=[[3 January]] [[2007]]|publisher=[[Union of Concerned Scientists]]|accessdate=2007-01-11}}</ref><ref name="mojo">[http://www.motherjones.com/news/feature/2005/05/some_like_it_hot.html Some Like It Hot, ''Mother Jones'' article on Milloy]</ref> Milloy is now an adjunct analyst at CEI.<ref name="titleCEI Experts">{{cite web |url=http://www.cei.org/dyn/experts.cfm |title=CEI Experts |accessdate=2008-03-07 |format= |work=}}</ref>
â
Recently, President of American Council on Renewable Energy (ACORE) Michael T. Eckhart sent Marlo Lewis, senior fellow of the Competitive Enterprise Institute (CEI) threatening letter vowing to "destroy" his career:{{Cquote|
+
Recently, President of American Council on Renewable Energy (ACORE) Michael T. Eckhart sent Marlo Lewis, senior fellow of the Competitive Enterprise Institute (CEI) threatening letter vowing to "destroy" his career:{{Quote|
"It is my intention to destroy your career as a liar," Mr. Eckhart wrote. "If you produce one more editorial against climate change, I will launch a campaign against your professional integrity. I will call you a liar and charlatan to the Harvard community of which you and I are members. I will call you out as a man who has been bought by Corporate America. Go ahead, guy. Take me on."<ref name="titleInside the Beltwayï¿½-ï¿½-ï¿½The Washington Times, Americas Newspaper">{{cite web |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/article/20070727/NATION02/107270089 |title=Inside the Beltwayï¿½-ï¿½-ï¿½The Washington Times, America's Newspaper |accessdate=2008-03-07 |format= |work=}}</ref>}}
"It is my intention to destroy your career as a liar," Mr. Eckhart wrote. "If you produce one more editorial against climate change, I will launch a campaign against your professional integrity. I will call you a liar and charlatan to the Harvard community of which you and I are members. I will call you out as a man who has been bought by Corporate America. Go ahead, guy. Take me on."<ref name="titleInside the Beltwayï¿½-ï¿½-ï¿½The Washington Times, Americas Newspaper">{{cite web |url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/article/20070727/NATION02/107270089 |title=Inside the Beltwayï¿½-ï¿½-ï¿½The Washington Times, America's Newspaper |accessdate=2008-03-07 |format= |work=}}</ref>}}
